intro: Galium papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Galium papuanum is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
